definition: sentence/clause/phrase/classifier for phrases or lines of verse
mouth/classifier for things with mouths (people, domestic animals, cannons, wells etc)/classifier for bites or mouthfuls
Jurong county level city in Zhenjiang 鎮江|镇江[Zhen4 jiang1], Jiangsu

sentences.english: I can resist everything except temptation" is a very interesting epigram ."
sentences.chinese: “除了誘惑我什麼都能夠抵制”是句非常有趣的雋語。

sentences.english: Please turn the sentence into english.
sentences.chinese: 請把這個句於澤成英語。

sentences.english: If you can blurt out 300 sentences, you can make a living in America.
sentences.chinese: 脫口而出300句英語，你可以在美國工作。

sentences.english: So any complex sentence just keep them together.
sentences.chinese: 所以任何複雜句都能把他們合在一起。

sentences.english: Chapter three discusses some problems of SVS in syntactic dimension.
sentences.chinese: 第三章論述連動句的句法平面中的若干問題。

sentences.english: The audience was amused by his speech full of epigrams.
sentences.chinese: “除了誘惑我什麼都能夠抵制”是句非常有趣的雋語。

sentences.english: The ancestors of the Tibetan race built up Gouding old kingdom from the Spring and Autumn Era to the Han and Jin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 自春秋至漢晉時代，壯族先民創建了句町古國。

sentences.english: Now write sentences in the past tense from the following prompts.
sentences.chinese: 仿照示例，用過去時將所給詞語連接成句。

sentences.english: Sentence group is a processing unit between sentence and paragraph.
sentences.chinese: 句羣是介於句子和段落之間的一個處理單位。

sentences.english: The author summarizes three particular properties of this kind of sentence in syntactic and semantic aspects.
sentences.chinese: 文章分析了花園幽徑句的三個句法語義特性。

sentences.english: This poem serves as a preface.
You should use two spaces after a sentence-ending period.
sentences.chinese: 應該在句尾的句號後邊加上兩個空格。

sentences.english: Notice the topic sentence is usually the first or the last sentence of a paragraph .
sentences.chinese: 注意主題句經常是一個自然段的第一句或最後一句。

sentences.english: In the disappearing existence sentences, the verbs must be mono-valent ones.
sentences.chinese: 隱現句中的動詞只能是一價動詞。

definition: word/statement/speech/lyrics/CL:組|组[zu3],個|个[ge4]/a form of lyric poetry, flourishing in the Song dynasty 宋朝|宋朝[Song4 chao2]/CL:首[shou3]
to make a pun/to have a double meaning/double entendre
